wikipedia_page.main: Major Lawrence Kimball (25 October 1900 – 30 December 1971) was a Conservative Party politician elected as the Member of Parliament for Loughborough between 1931 and 1945.Lawrence Kimball, born in 1900, was the son of Marcus Morton Kimball and Jeannie Lawrence Perkins and the father of Marcus, Lord Kimball.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1931 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1935 United Kingdom general election

response: The son of Major Lawrence Kimball,"Kimball (Life Baron UK), Marcus Richard Kimball", Dod's Parliamentary Companion, ed. Andrew Cox, et al,, Vacher Dod Publishing, 1999 he was born in Marylebone, London, and educated at Eton College and Trinity College, Cambridge. He became a farmer and a Lloyd's underwriter. He was a councillor on Rutland County Council and commanded a squadron of the Leicestershire Yeomanry.
